wikipedia_page.main:
John Blackie LLD DL (1805–1873) was a 19th-century Scottish publisher and the "son" of Blackie & Son who served as Lord Provost of Glasgow from 1863 to 1866.
The company specialised in printing annotated bibles and religious works including Scotland's first religious newspaper, the Scottish Guardian.
